src_text: Tanihi NSA, u pfune Carter eku tameleni timhaka misava hi vutswatsi, tanihi Camp David Accords, 1978; a hlela vuxaka exikarhi ka US–China emalembeni ya le ku heleni ka va-1970; Hundzuluko wa Iran, loyi vangeke hasahasa ya mpfalelo wa Iran, hi 1979; swin’we ni ku hlasela ka Soviet le Afghanistan, hi 1979.
ref_text: As NSA, he assisted Carter in diplomatically handling world affairs, such as the Camp David Accords, 1978; normalizing US–China relations thought the late 1970s; the Iranian Revolution, which led to the Iran hostage crisis, 1979; and the Soviet invasion in Afghanistan, 1979.
hyp_text: As NSA, he helped Carter bridge the gap between the two nations, resulting in the 1978 Camp David Accords; he worked closely with the Chinese government, especially in establishing diplomatic relations (US-PRC) and opening trade opportunities; the Iran hostage crisis of 1979–1981, in which Brzezinski was the architect of the failed military rescue attempt, Operation Eagle Claw; and the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan, in which he engineered a policy of arming the mujaheddin resistance (which culminated in the Soviets’ 10-year war in Afghanistan and contributed to the eventual downfall of the USSR).
